translation: Hello, everyone.
transcript: 呃，大家好！

translation: I am Cui Xiaobo from TalkingData and I'm very glad to come here at Zaojiu Future.
transcript: 我是TalkingData的崔晓波，就非常高兴有这个机会来到造就FUTURE的现场。

translation: I hope in the next 20 minutes, I can explain clearly our understaning of a proper relationship between a city and data.
transcript: 也希望呢我们在短短的20分钟左右，能够跟大家讲清楚我们理解的城市和数据的关系。

translation: First of all, we will look at a set of data.
transcript: 那么首先呢我们看一组数据。

translation: As of last year, the number of active mobile phones in China had reached 1.3 billion.
transcript: 那么现在截止到去年的话，实际上现在活跃的移动手机的数量已经将近13亿部。

translation: Mobile phones have already become an integral part of our daily life.
transcript: 所以它也成为人类生活习惯的一部分。

translation: In other words, we have seen the born of the bowed-head tribe.
transcript: 低头族已经产生了。

translation: Secondly, the number of wearable devices in China increases significantly.
transcript: 那么第二呢，其实可穿戴呢设备高速发展。

translation: For 40 million people, watch is the most common wearable device and there are other kinds of wearable devices.
transcript: 现在我们看到有将近4千万人，就他日常佩戴可穿戴设备，一个是手表，一个是其他的。

translation: The industry of the Internet of things is also developing rapidly.
transcript: 那么物联网的设备，也在高速地发展。

translation: As a result, both the volume and the dimension of the data have seen an exponential explosion.
transcript: 那么所有这一切呢实际上都造成了数据的体量和数据的维度，它是一个指数级的爆发。

translation: You know what, the amount of data being produced in China in a year will reach 35 billion EB in terms of storage capacity.
transcript: 那这有一个数据，就一年呢实际上在中国产生的数据的体量，它的存储量是 350亿EB。

translation: You might have no idea of its significance.
transcript: 这个大家肯定没有感觉。

translation: I will give you a vivid example.
transcript: 那我给大家一举一个形象的比比喻。

translation: If we put this amount of data into different hard drives with a storage capacity of 1T each, then the total size of these hard drives is not enough to cover the 9.6 million square kilometers of land in China.
transcript: 如果我们把这个数据都存在1T一块儿的硬盘里面，我们在地下一直铺的话，那么可以铺满中国的960万平方公里的土地也还不够。

translation: It is because the birth of mobile phones has caused an explosive increase in human behavioral data that keeps exploding at a high speed each year.
transcript: 就是由于移动手机的诞生它带来的人的行为数据高速地爆发，每一年每一年都是翻倍翻倍地往上涨。

translation: So in the next decade, we predict that the volume of overal data on the Internet of things will grow much faster than that of mobile Internet, which is big data.
transcript: 那么在未来十年我们预测，那物联网整个的这个数据的体量，会比整个移动互联网的这个数据的体量增长速度还要快，这是大数据。

translation: What exactly is big data?
transcript: 到底什么是大数据？

translation: How was big data produced in the first place?
transcript: 大数据到底是怎么产生的？

translation: Is there any difference between big data and other conventional data?
transcript: 那大数据跟以前的数据到底有什么区别？

translation: Well, we usually mix big data with other conventional data, but they are different.
transcript: 那我们平时呢，经常会把这些数据会跟我们以前传统那些数据混在一起，但其实不是。

translation: Only data that sees an exponential outbreak is called big data.
transcript: 因为只有呈指数级爆发的数据的增长才叫大数据。

translation: We all know the Moore's Law and our computing ability is growing at a high speed.
transcript: 我们都知道摩尔定律，所以我们的计算的能力也在随之高速发展。

translation: For instance, our CPUs, our existing computing ability, our mainframes, as well as the edge computing, we can see that the overall computing power has improved significantly in a synchronized manner.
transcript: 那我们现在的CPU，我们现在的计算能力，我们现在的主机，以及我们的边缘计算，所有的东西的算力也在腾步同步地在增长。

translation: Because of big data or the growth of computing power, we are able to gradually generate intelligence by ourselves.
transcript: 那么由于大数据，由于计算能力的增长是让我们慢慢地产生了智能。

translation: However, at this period of time, a complicated problem arises alongside the rapid increase of computing power and data volume.
transcript: 所以这时候呢，其实我们就有一个问题会摆在我们面前，那么这种算力的增长，数据体量的这个增加。

translation: In other words, our perspective on world will change from the physical materialism to that of data virtualization.
transcript: 那这句话就是我们看世界的角度将从实体物质化转化为数据虚拟化。

translation: I will first tell you a story, so that you can have a better understanding of this issue.
transcript: 我先给大家讲一个故事讲一个故事吧，所以大家会更有感觉去理解这件事情。

translation: Last year I visited a number of unmanned vehicle manufacturers in the US, including Waymo, a subsidiary of Google.
transcript: 因为去年的话，我去美国我去参观很多无人车的企业，就当时我们联系了像Google旗下的Waymo。

translation: I paid a visit to Phoenix where Waymo tests its vehicles, as you may know.
transcript: 去它的凤凰城，因为大家都知道那是Waymo主要的实验的一个城市。

translation: I managed to get into Waymo's experimental base, right into its lab.
transcript: 我好不容易进到它的这个实验的基地，进到它的实验室里面。

translation: I immediately noticed that there were two screens placing in front of each researcher.
transcript: 因为我意外地发现就它每个研究员面前都搁着两块儿屏幕。

translation: There was a written note posted on one of the screen, with the word "simulation" on it.
transcript: 其其中一块儿屏幕上呢贴了个纸条，上面用红字写的英文simulation，翻译过来就叫模拟。

translation: Out of curiosity, I patted the shoulder of a researcher next to me, and asked, "What is this note for?"
transcript: 嘶所以我就很好奇，我就拍旁边一个研究员的肩膀，我就说诶为什么你要贴这个纸条儿？

translation: He said that they didn't do that before, however, "Sometimes, I don't know which is the real world and which is the simulated world made by sequence of binary digits. In my eyes they seem to be pretty much the same."
transcript: 因为他说以前我们是不贴的，但后来呢我有时候我分不清楚哪个是真实的世界，哪个是我们用数字去模拟的世界，在我眼中好像看起来已经差不多了。

translation: So we wonder, why is an Internet giant like Google doing this kind of things?
transcript: 那么我们就在想，为什么像Google这样的顶尖的公司它做这件事情？

translation: Let's take the unmanned car industry for example, Google now has the largest drive test data after over 10 years' continuous investment.
transcript: 我们就拿无人车这个行业来举例，那么现在无人车拥有无人车的路测数据最多的像Google，投入了十年。

translation: The volume of the data is about 4 million miles of drive test.
transcript: 大概有400万英里的路测数据。

translation: Tesla now has about 80,000 to 100,000 cars on the road each year, collecting all sorts of drive test data every day and the data volume is about 1 million miles.
transcript: 但像Tesla这样的公司，一年在外面大概有将近8万到10万辆的车在跑，每天给它收集各种各样的路测数据，大概也就是100万英里左右。

translation: But for a real driverless car to be able to hit the road, how much drive test data does it need?
transcript: 但是真正的一个无人车，如果你要跑到一个无人驾驶的状态，你要去上路，大家知道要多少路测数据吗？

translation: The drive test data of at least 100 million miles.
transcript: 至少一亿英里。

translation: The current data collecting speed is too slow to achieve this goal, and how can we solve this problem?
transcript: 那么按照现在人类这个积累的速度是完全不可能的，那怎么来解决？

translation: They ended up developing a simulation system, where they digitized every building, every road, street and even every tree or obstacle within Phoenix.
transcript: 实际上他们就开发了这样一套模拟系统，他们把凤凰城的每一个建筑物，每一个道路，每一个街道，甚至每一棵树木，每一个障碍物。

translation: They managed to digitize the city with various methods.
transcript: 我们都通过很多这种方法，我们把它数字化，把它用一个数字化的一个城市的方式表示出来。

translation: In the mean time, different simulation programs of unmanned cars are put into use.
transcript: 同时呢它会用很多的这种无人车的模拟程序。

translation: The unmanned cars will run in these simulated cities, ending up generating drive test data that covers over 1 million miles a day.
transcript: 在这样一个模拟的城市里面去跑，那么它一天就能模拟一百万英里的路测数据。

translation: To us it is a new phenomenon.
transcript: 所以这就就是说我们看到了。

translation: Someone might carry out a research on city development or other commercial problems, however, researches are no longer carried out in the physical world.
transcript: 就说其实所有人他研究城市也好，研究别的商业问题也好，他慢慢地已经不在实体的世界里面去研究了。

translation: Through abstracting and digitizing, people can create a digital world.
transcript: 他都想把它抽象化、数字化，到一个数字的世界里面。

translation: By making full use of infinite computing power and exponential data generating capability through the application of the Moore's laws, AI's comprehension capacity of the world could be accelerated with an enhanced learning method.
transcript: 用无穷的以集合以指数级摩尔定律方式去成长的计算能力和数据能力，加速AI对世界的理解，利用增强学习的方法产生对世界的反馈。

translation: So this is a stage that all industries will have to go through in the future, so that's the reality we have to face now.
transcript: 所以这是未来所有的行业都必须经历的一个阶段，所以这是我们看到的实际的情况。

translation: Let's get back to our topic today, we are talking about our cities.
transcript: 那么回归到我们今天的话题，要讲城市。

translation: When we try to study cities, what are cities like in our minds?
transcript: 那么其实我们以前看城市，我们想象的城市是什么？

translation: By city, do we mean the buildings that are made of steel or reinforced concrete or leisure facilities and parks?
transcript: 是钢铁是钢筋水泥的建筑，还是说我们休闲的设施、公园等等？

translation: But somehow we gradually realized that the cities are not meant to be cold nor static.
transcript: 但其实呢，我慢慢地发现其实我们看到城市，我们觉得它可能不是冷冰冰的、不是静态的。

translation: Look at this picture, it is made of pedestrian flow data in Beijing.
transcript: 就像这张图表示一样，这是我们拿北京所有的人流的这种数据。

translation: We did a visual simulation with the data.
transcript: 实际上我们做了一个比较可视化的一个模拟。

translation: We can now see it clearly, the ever running pedestrian flow in Beijing looks like our blood vascular system.
transcript: 我们可以看出来，就说川流不息的人群实际上在北京它就形成了像脉搏一样的东西。

translation: This is only a picture, but for those who worked in urban planning and urban research, is there any difference compared to your former experience?
transcript: 那只看到这样的一个画面，因为我们很多人以前都是跟城城市规划、城市研究相关的工作的，跟以前有什么最大的不？

translation: Yes, the major difference is that it is dynamic, anything inside the picture is real time, and I can see the changes taking place at any given moment.
transcript: 对了，它最大的不同就是有动感，它所有的东西是实时的，我实时地就能够看到所有的变化。

translation: So, technological advancement and the development of data have made it possible to build a model that is completely dynamic, responsive and real-time; and by doing so we can look at our cities from a totally different perspective.
transcript: 那么现在技术以及数据的发展让这种完全动态的、响应的、实时的模型变成了一有一种可能性，所以我们看整个城市的方法也随之改变。

translation: Now please look at this picture.
transcript: 那么我们来看看这张图。

translation: It is an interesting picture, despite that it is not very clear.
transcript: 这张图非常有意思，可能稍微有点不清楚。

translation: I will explain.
transcript: 我解释一下。

translation: This picture represents the map of Beijing.
transcript: 那么我们看到这张图因为是北京的这个北京的这个城区的图。

translation: There are two colors in the picture, red and blue.
transcript: 就里面呢主要有两种颜色，就一种呢是红颜色，一种呢是蓝颜色。

translation: What does the color red stand for?
transcript: 那红颜色表示的是什么？

translation: It refers to high-income population.
transcript: 实际上是高收入人群。

translation: Then what does the color blue stand for?
transcript: 那蓝颜色表示的是什么？

translation: It refers to low-income population.
transcript: 就是相对于来说低收入人群。

translation: We are using this picture to analyze the movement or trajectory of any given customer group.
transcript: 就为什么我们这样来表示这样一个人群在城市里面的这样一些这个作轨迹也好，动态也好？

translation: In fact it is a conventional urban research method.
transcript: 实际上这就是我们非常传统的研究城市的方法。

translation: The entire urban planning, including the urban research method, can date back to the 18th century of the industrial age.
transcript: 因为现现代的这个整个儿这个城市规划，包括研究城市的方法，其实都源于18世纪，基本上是在工业时代。

translation: At that period of time, resources were scarce, and naturally a centralized supply system was introduced so as to ensure the rationalized use of different resources.
transcript: 因为那个时候是资源非常匮乏，所以我们对所有这种资源和供给都是属于叫中心型的这种供给。

translation: For this reason, most cities would have financial streets or CBD among others.
transcript: 所以会在很多城市会产生金融街、CBD等等。

translation: However, this kind of centralized supply system will cause great pressure to our modern cities, in terms of traffic network, supporting facilities and educational system among others.
transcript: 但实际上对于现代的城市来说，它会造成非常大的压力，交通的压力，配套设施的压力，教育设施的压力等等。

translation: This is not suitable for cities in the future.
transcript: 所以这对未来的城市它一定是不太合适的。

translation: Well, when we take a close look at this picture, we find out that some problems have already occurred in Beijing, a densely populated city.
transcript: 那这张图我们仔细观察我们会发现，在北京这样的，就人这么密集的城市里面其实已经出现了一些问题。

translation: What do we call this phenomenon?
transcript: 这个现象我们叫什么？

translation: We call it the space-time folding.
transcript: 我们叫时空折叠。

translation: What exactly is space-time folding?
transcript: 什么叫时空折叠？

translation: You will find out that people with different income levels, from different social classes, despite that they are living in the same city, the chance for them to interact with each other is rather slim.
transcript: 就是你会发现它不同收入层次，不同阶层的人，实际上他们在同一个城市里面，他们发生碰撞，发生交互的机会非常少。

translation: Why?
transcript: 是由于什么？

translation: It is due to many factors, including their different living habits, nature of their works and different timetables.
transcript: 由于生活习惯，由于工作性质，由于等等作息时间各种原因。

translation: As a result, these two types of people don't interact with each other at all.
transcript: 实际上这两类人他碰不到。

translation: What kind of impact will it have on a city?
transcript: 那碰不到呢会对一个产市城市产生什么样的影响？

translation: In fact, the impact has been proved by early theoretical researches.
transcript: 其实这在这在理论上早已经被证明了。

translation: It is necessary for people from different social class in a city to communicate or interact with each other, so that the city will have more vitality.
transcript: 就一个真正有活力的城市，它不同阶层的人需要有很多交互，有很多交流，有很多碰到的机会，这个城市才会变得有活力。

translation: But a city that is based on centralized supply system is unable to facilitate interaction among people from different social classes and that is why the space-time folding occurs.
transcript: 但像以前我们这种中心供给制的这种城市的规划方式的话，是完全达不到这一点，所以就会产生时空折叠的现象。

translation: The space-time folding will cause a series of security problems for the city, such as polarization between the rich and the poor, as well as the unreasonable allocation of different resources and facilities.
transcript: 那时空折叠对一个城市会带来各种安全的问题，啊，这个贫富分化的问题，以及相应的设施、配给各种各样的问题。

translation: We have noticed this phenomenon in many other cities for there are already some problems in China's current urban planning framework.
transcript: 所以这是我们实际看到的，现在在中国的这种城市规划里面，已经产生了各种各样的问题。

translation: Is there any effective measure to tackle these problems?
transcript: 那么有没有方法能够来解决这个问题呢？

translation: Actually we have carried out many experimental projects in Beijing.
transcript: 其实我们做了一些实验，我们在北京。

translation: In fact, we managed to collect information of the residents in Beijing.
transcript: 实际上我们拿了北京市民的。

translation: The size of resident population of Beijing is about 26 million to 27 million, and by virtue of big data, we have acquired data concerning nearly 10 million residents in Beijing.
transcript: 因为北京的常住人口将近2600到2700万，然后我们是用大数据的方法，我们采集了将近一千万人的数据。

translation: What kind of data is it?
transcript: 主要是什么样的数据呢？

translation: Firstly, the data contains information relating to a resident's offline behaviors, location and movement tracks; secondly, the data contains information of residents' online behaviors, including the online visit habits and the frequently visited websites among others.
transcript: 就第一，他在线下的所有的行为、位置和轨迹；第二，他在线上的所有的访问习惯、访问网址等等这些行为。

translation: What do we plan to do with the data?
transcript: 那么通过这种方法的话，其实我们想做什么？

translation: We want to re-classify the residents in Beijing, instead of classifying them into white-collar or blue-collar workers simply based on their income level in a cold and indifferent way.
transcript: 其实我们想尝试把人群做一个重新的分类，并不是像原来那种冷冰冰的，我就按照收入结构，或者白领儿、蓝领儿，我把这个我城市的居民分一下。

translation: So we applied a machine-assisted learning tool to help us do the re-classification job, and the diagram produced by this method is very interesting.
transcript: 那么仔细分一下的话，实际上我们用机器学习的方法，实际上用机器、用矩列的方法帮我们来分一分，所以这个图很有意思。

translation: We named people with the same behavioral pattern, but the identification of people with the same behavioral pattern was completely carried out by the machine.
transcript: 但这些名字实际上是我们给它加的，但这种用他的行为聚集起来这些人群是机器机器学习的方法。

translation: In other words, the machine helped us identify these different types of people.
transcript: 用机器帮我们聚的。

translation: You will soon find out that the machine has a very similar cognition compared to human.
transcript: 但是你会发现很有意思，其实跟人的认知是非常接近的。

translation: People living in a big city have totally different lifestyles.
transcript: 因为你会有发现在大城市里面，其实所有人群的习惯其实在变了。

translation: In the past, most people were wage earners who started their work at 9 am and finished their work at 5 pm; but now the machine finds out there is a group of people whom we call "the happy stay-at-home fathers".
transcript: 就已经不是像原来那样就都是以这种朝九晚五的上班族为主，它已经发现了，我们叫居家深宅幸福奶爸。

translation: Yes, they usually play computer games, keep a close eye on mother and baby products, and receive deliveries of purchased goods at home.
transcript: 对，他们这个平时玩儿游戏，然后这个每天待在家里关注母婴的东西，然后等等，然后经常收快递。

translation: I must say that the proportion of this group of people is not low at all.
transcript: 对，已经出现了这样的人群，而且比例并不低。

translation: There is another type of people, and we call them "urban freelance workers".
transcript: 那也出现了一些我们叫这个城市自由工。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么？

translation: Because, you know, with the rapid development of sharing economy, more and more people enter the food delivery or express delivery industry and become urban freelance workers.
transcript: 因为大家知道这共享经济的发展，外卖、快递的这种发展，实际上出现了很多就说城市自由工。

translation: They have a considerable commuting distance each day, as most of them live in the outskirt areas.
transcript: 你会发现他们的每天通勤距离非常远，大部分人住在远郊区县。

translation: However, they spend most of their time at an outdoor environment and travel extensively within the city.
transcript: 但他每天的里面在城市里面活动非常多，每天都待在室外。

translation: There are a large number of them.
transcript: 所以这样的人群也占了很大的比例。

translation: What else?
transcript: 那还有什么呢？

translation: There is a young female group who love literature and art shows, spend most of their time shopping and are sensitive to the cosmetic market.
transcript: 就我们叫年轻、文艺的、买买买的这个女性人群，她们经常要去看演出，她们关注化妆、购物等等。

translation: Gradually we come to realize that birds of a feather flock together, and it is really happening in the real life.
transcript: 所以未来其实我们发现，其实人他慢慢地，我们叫人以群分，但是人以群分的基础真的出现了。

translation: People can be classified into different groups by their lifestyle, their life track and habits.
transcript: 它实际上是按照人的生活方式，按人的生活轨迹，按人的活动习惯去分。

translation: This is the right direction for our research.
transcript: 所以这是未来我们觉得就真正。

translation: When having this new perspective, we came to realize that big data wasn't cold nor indifferent, instead, it could be people-oriented and reflect people's lifestyle, or even the personality of an individual.
transcript: 如果我们换个角度，那我们现在就觉得那大数据其实不是冷冰冰的，它都是以人为本的，它反映的就是人，反映人的生活习惯，反映人这个个体，甚至反映他的个性。

translation: Therefore we re-designed our research module.
transcript: 那么我们重新规划了一个角度。

translation: We wanted to find a urban planning mechanism that enabled residents to live a comfortable life.
transcript: 其实我们要想如何让这些人，他在这个城市里面过得比较舒服，过得比较爽才可以。

translation: So we came up with a brand new system and we call it "the City Lens".
transcript: 据此呢其实我们也产生了一些这个新的系统，啊这样一个系统我们叫city lens，叫城市透镜。

translation: This system is based on a big data technology which is perceptual computing.
transcript: 那么这样这样一个系统呢，实际上我们是利用了一些大数据的方法，其实我们叫感知计算。

translation: We use a variety of methods, including sensors, to collect data involving the city, the residents, cars, streets and all sorts of public facilities.
transcript: 我们用各种各样的手法去把通过传感器，把城市里面各种各样的关于人、关于物、关于汽车、关于街道、关于所有、关于公共设施所有的数据采集上来。

translation: But it is not the most important thing, as you know that it is all static data.
transcript: 但这并不重要，这都是静态的数据。

translation: We want to do something more, and we are trying to create a three-dimensional model to reflect our city.
transcript: 我们更关键的，我们是尝试在城市里面，我们建一个立体的模型。

translation: If you are familiar with Beijing, and you will know that this location is somewhere near Beijing World Tower, and the building bearing the red mark is the China Hotel.
transcript: 如果大家熟悉北京的话，这个位置就是在北京国贸那个区域，那个用红色标注的那些建筑就是这个中国大饭店。

translation: When you take a close look at this area, you will notice that there are different kinds of people there.
transcript: 那么投影到这样一个区域的话，你会看到里面有很多不同的人群。

translation: There were 7 groups of people, as we have classified, and we could see the behavioral pattern of them in this area, including their activity frequency and habits.
transcript: 这里面的人群就是我们刚才分的那七类人群，他在国贸这个区域，他的活动频率和活动习惯。

translation: So when will they show up in this area?
transcript: 所以他到底什么样的时间才会出现在这个区域？

translation: By applying this new approach, we have offered a new solution to the urban development in the future.
transcript: 那么基于这样的一种新的方法的话，其实我们对未来城市的这种建设。

translation: The idea is totally different.
transcript: 它的思路会变得完全不同。

translation: We call it "the city-response model".
transcript: 因为我们叫城市响应模型。

translation: In other words, the future city is not powered by centralized supply system anymore.
transcript: 就未来的城市它不是供中心供给的。

translation: The city will redistribute its resources based on the lifestyle and gathering spots of its residents.
transcript: 而是我针对这些人群的习惯、他的聚集地，我要重新去规划我城市所有的资源。

translation: So I think in the future, what matters it not about having a financial street, a CBD or a university town in a city.
transcript: 所以我觉得未来特往往不是说我这儿有一个金融街，我那有一个CBD，我那有一个所谓这个大学区，往往不是这样。

translation: Rather, within a given area, as long as a particular group of people are gathering together, we need to provide support to them, by setting up a neighborhood center as in Singapore, or a community center, so as to minimize their commuting time and give them access to a great variety of public infrastructure facilities.
transcript: 而是它可能在一个区域里面，只要这样类似的人群它聚集的时候，你要你就要配一个就类似于新巴新加坡那样的邻里中心、社区中心，解决掉他所有的问题，让他减少通勤，让他享有足够的基础设施。

translation: To us, it is a new way to study the urban development in the future.
transcript: 所以这是我们看到的一种新的方法可以去研究未来城市怎么去建设。

translation: So is it enough to only have the human behavior information?
transcript: 那么只有人的行为是不是够呢？

translation: Far from enough.
transcript: 我们发现远远不够。

translation: We notice that our governments and enterprises as well have paid too much attention to the human behavior reflected by the big data.
transcript: 就太多的这个政府包括企业，实际上它我觉得它们就太在乎就是说大数据反映出来的人的行为。

translation: But gradually we come to realize that human behavior is not important at all.
transcript: 但逐步我们其实发现，其实人的行为一点都不重要。

translation: What matter to us is that why a man is driven to do something, and why this man will form a special lifestyle in the first place.
transcript: 其实人的星行为后面的那些，人的心智，就他为什么要做这件事情，他为什么要是这样的一个生活习惯。

translation: To us that is the most important thing.
transcript: 其实对我我们来说是更重要的。

translation: So we set up a people-oriented data lab, a joint project with Media Lab from the MTI.
transcript: 所以据此呢其实我们也成立了我们叫人本数据实验室，这个我们是跟MIT的Media Lab，就媒呃媒介实验室来合作的这样的一个实验室。

translation: What is the Lab for?
transcript: 他们是用来研究什么？

translation: In fact, researchers don't study human behaviors at all, they are very concerned about the human mind.
transcript: 其实他们不研究人的行为，他们非常关注人的心智。

translation: They conduct various community activities, interviewing people and talking to them.
transcript: 他们做很多社区活动，他们做很多访谈，他们跟人去交流。

translation: These researchers want to find out the reason behind a man's particular behavioral pattern.
transcript: 他们想知道就说，人的行为的背后代表的他的想法就他的心理到底是什么。

translation: This research institution, which is actually made up of a group of sociologists and psychologists, studies the relationship between the human body and the environment.
transcript: 所以这样的这样的一个研究机构，它实际上是由一群的社会学家和心理学家构成的，那么它研究的是人的身体跟环境之间的关系。

translation: Why is it important to have this kind of research?
transcript: 因为为什么要做这样的研究？

translation: Please take a look at the picture on your left.
transcript: 其实大家可以看看左边这张图。

translation: It is produced by City Lens Lab, a joint project with MIT.
transcript: 这个实际上就是我们在 city sense lab，实际上我们做的一个，跟MIT合作的一个project。

translation: It is a city made by LEGO pieces.
transcript: 这是一个用乐高搭起的一个城市。

translation: It's a panoramic view of a city made by LEGO pieces.
transcript: 然后这是一张全景图，底下有乐高搭起的城市。

translation: In reality, it is a city module made by digital simulations.
transcript: 上面呢实际上是一个，完全对城市的一个数字化模拟的一个系统。

translation: What is this system for?
transcript: 那这个系统是用来干什么？

translation: It is placed in Paris, France and it is designed to facilitate interaction with local residents.
transcript: 因为它在法国巴黎，实际上是用来做这种跟市民的交互的。

translation: I have studied a number of smart city projects across the country, however, the ideology behind these projects is still driven by concepts such as strengthened management, supervision and oversight.
transcript: 因为我我今天呢其实，我最近呢看了很多这个中国这个智慧城市的一些项目，但我觉得呢好像大家的思路，还是管理、监管、洞察等等。

translation: To me, that is not the future trend at all.
transcript: 但实际上我觉得这不是未来。

translation: For example, to build a transportation facility or a new landmark in the city, the government will have a hearing which requires active participation of the residents.
transcript: 真正的未来，因为在那边的，它在开一个听证会，我要改变一个交通设施的规划，我要建筑建设一个新的一个比较重要建筑物的时候，实际上市民是高度参与的。

translation: So at the hearing we have urban planning authorities standing there, but a resident might come up, with a LEGO module in his hands.
transcript: 那么市长规划部门站在那儿，但是同时会有市民站在旁边儿。

translation: He might say that, "I want to move that building to a new location, this commercial office building and that residential building should exchange location."
transcript: 他会拿一个乐高说，我想把这个建筑物移到那个位置去，我想把这个商业的一个写字楼，跟一个住宅地产，我换换位置。

translation: That's the purpose of this system.
transcript: 它是用来做这个的。

translation: Each adjustment will naturally lead to the changes of different key data.
transcript: 那它一每每次调整的时候，后面所有的数字会跟着变。

translation: Whenever you relocate a particular building, the system will help you figure out a number of key data, including the commuting index, traffic congestion index, trend of the house price and consumption index.
transcript: 你调整一个建筑的位置，它会用一套模型帮你重新算出来，那当地的这个通勤指数到底是什么样，你这样换了之后，会不会产生新的拥堵？房价会不会升高？消费指数会不会下降？

translation: This is something that the public is very concerned about in the future.
transcript: 这是未来就说市民非常关心的东西。

translation: We have seen many advanced cities in the world are following this approach, and people-oriented concept has been incorporated into their urban planning and construction.
transcript: 所以我们看到的就说，一些先进的城市，实际上它的城市，整个的这种建设和规划是非常回归本质的，是以人为本。

translation: We have carried out other projects as well, as we want to have an in-depth research on this topic.
transcript: 那么为了深入研究呢，其实我们又做了一些这种研究的一些项目。

translation: And this project is the most representative one.
transcript: 这是其中一个比较有代表性的。

translation: This project is based in Dashilan in Beijing.
transcript: 这个项目的位置呢是在我们叫这个北京的这个大栅栏儿。

translation: Please raise your hands if you have heard of this place.
transcript: 呃有听过大栅栏儿的人举一下手？

translation: Good, half of the audiences know about this place.
transcript: 啊还是不错的啊，一多半人都知道。

translation: It is somewhere near Qianmen in Beijing, and now it is a famous tourist attraction.
transcript: 因为它实际上就在北京的前门那个位置，实际上是一个非常有名的一个旅游区。

translation: Designers love this spot.
transcript: 做设计的人，特别喜欢。

translation: We once made a thermodynamic diagram during the golden week of the National Day holiday.
transcript: 图呢实际上是我们当时测了一个热力图，就在十一黄金周设计周的时候啊。

translation: There is a street, named Yangmeizhuxiejie, in the middle of the Dashilan, and the layouts in the left and right side are completely different.
transcript: 我们大栅栏儿中间有一条街叫杨梅竹斜街儿，就它左边跟右边的布置完全不一样。

translation: How so?
transcript: 为什么不一样？

translation: The left side is the renovation area by the government, where old buildings were demolished and many so called time-honored brands were moved into a high-end commercial district.
transcript: 因为左边是政府改变的规划，它把那边全部推平了，盖了很高大上的一些商业区，放了很多所谓的老字号进去。

translation: The right side remains intact, mostly being quadrangle courtyard, old town and old hutong.
transcript: 右边呢没动，全是四合院儿、老城区、老胡同。

translation: The thermodynamic diagram tells a fact vividly.
transcript: 但是那张热力图我们看得非常清楚。

translation: People will flock to the old town and quadrangle courtyards during daytime, but nobody loves visiting the so-called high-end commercial district endorsed by urban planning authorities.
transcript: 白天人全都去老城区和四合院儿，其实没有人喜欢去，就政府规划的这样的一些所谓的高大上的一些这个商业区。

translation: We wanted to run an experiment.
transcript: 所以我们就做了一个实验。

translation: How did we do it?
transcript: 我们做这个实验是什么？

translation: We developed a game for residents living on that street.
transcript: 我们开发了一个游戏，我们给杨梅竹斜街儿的这种居民。

translation: It is like playing LEGO.
transcript: 就像前面搭乐高一样。

translation: We invited these residents to place various buildings anywhere as they liked.
transcript: 我们给了他一套系统，你可以按照你的想法，去摆各种各样的建筑物。

translation: The buildings in different colors are various infrastructure facilities, including restaurants, convenient facilities and small shops.
transcript: 它不同的颜色表示的是不同类型的这种基础设施，有的是餐厅、有的是便民设施、有的是小卖部。

translation: And we invite elder citizens and children to play with this game.
transcript: 啊这个大爷大妈，甚至小孩儿你过来就做这个游戏。

translation: We said to them, "It is your community. If you are the designer of this community, what will you do?"
transcript: 就说哎你生活在这个社区里，你来设计一下，这块儿到底应该怎么去规划？

translation: So you can tell that it is a fun game.
transcript: 所以这个就非常有意思。

translation: The picture on the right is particularly interesting.
transcript: 所以我们会看右边的图特别好玩儿。

translation: You can find out that local residents are rather imaginative.
transcript: 你会发现当地的居民啧非常有想象力。

translation: Their space design plan is beyond our imagination.
transcript: 就是这种摆法我们都想不出来。

translation: We can tell the rationality of this kind of space design.We also looked for professional assistance from urban planning authorities and they provided us their design plan.
transcript: 但你会发现就居民设计的这样的一些这个整个儿社区的摆放和结构的话。

translation: To be honest, the design plan by residents is more reasonable, or more adaptable to their daily life in that community.
transcript: 其实坦率地说我们也找了规划部门，它也给我们一个设计，居民设计得更合理，更贴近他们的生活，贴近这个社区的这种本质。

translation: More and more communities with this kind of design concept have emerged in China, communities that are people-oriented.
transcript: 所以这是我们看到实际在这个中国已经出现了这样一些，就非常有非常贴近于人文关怀的一些社区的一种构造。

translation: It is an ongoing project on that street.
transcript: 现在我们在杨梅竹斜街儿里面。

translation: If you have free time, please take a look there.
transcript: 如果大家有空去的话，真的可以去看一看。

translation: We have placed many advanced equipment and devices in those quadrangle courtyards, so as to help local residents improve the quality of lives.
transcript: 很多四合院儿里面，我们放了很多很先进的一些设备，其实就是为了让当地的这种居民生活得感觉更好。

translation: I would say by this way we are collecting people-oriented data.
transcript: 所以这是我们看到就说，整个儿这个我们叫人本数据。

translation: Why?
transcript: 就是为什么？

translation: We have to take a people-oriented approach to carry out urban planning, or smart city or smart community projects, we must return back to the fundamental relation between a city and data.
transcript: 就是做城市规划也好，做智慧城市也好，做智慧社区也好，其实我们要以人为本，我们要回归到城市和数据的这个本质。

translation: The data is collected from the people, and naturally we should make good use of the data analysis result so as to better serve the general public.
transcript: 数据本身呢就是取之于民，最终它要用之于民它才是合理的。

translation: Seven years ago, when we first started our company, several founders of the company had a nice chat at a park.
transcript: 七年前，我们创立我们这个公司的时候，其实我们几个创始人坐在公园里。

translation: We asked ourselves a question, "What is the ultimate role of data technology if we manage to do it well?"
transcript: 呃这个一直在想就是数据这件事情，它做到终极，它到底能解决什么问题？

translation: We summed up two sentences at that time, we believed that data technology will change the decision-making process of all enterprises.
transcript: 其实我们当时总结了两句话，我们觉得数据会改变企业的决策。

translation: In the past, many hasty decisions were made by instinct, or in accordance with seniority or official titles; however, more and more Chinese enterprises will use a data-driven approach to increase their commercial value.
transcript: 因为越来越多的中国的企业，实际上它不会只靠拍脑袋、靠直觉、靠官职大小、靠嗓门儿高低来决定一件事情，它慢慢地会用数据驱动的方法来创造很多商业的价值。

translation: That is why we believe that the data technology will help improve the quality of our lives, and that was one of our original aspirations.
transcript: 那么也我们也觉得就是说，数据未来它会改变人类的这种生活品质，所以这是我们的一个初心。

translation: Smart intelligence and intelligence are widely discussed in recent years.
transcript: 那么这几年呢，因为大家一直在说智能啊、智慧。

translation: I will tell you our understanding of the real intelligence.
transcript: 我那我们我们理解的智能到底是什么？

translation: There are way too many intelligences, including AI, unmanned drones, intelligent robots or unmanned cars, and then we start calling VR as a form of AI.
transcript: 因为现在智能太多了，啊什么都是人工什么都是人工智能，呃无人机、然后机器人儿、无人车然后等等吧，呃甚至VR也叫人工智能了。

translation: So actually from our point of view, it's very simple.
transcript: 那么实际上从我们角度来说，特简单。

translation: Intelligence only deals with one thing, which is decision making.
transcript: 但智能呢其实只管一件事情就是决策。

translation: By nature, artificial intelligence helps us make a sound decision based on the data analysis results.
transcript: 它的本质就是利用数据产生的智能做决定。

translation: Do I need to open a shop at this location?
transcript: 我要不要在这个地方开店？

translation: Shall I lend money to this guy?
transcript: 我要不要给这个人借钱？

translation: Is it necessary to make a building over there?
transcript: 我要不要在这儿盖这个建筑物？

translation: Shall I run some resident activities at that site?
transcript: 我要不要在这儿做个居民的活动？

translation: These all involve artificial intelligence.
transcript: 这些所有都是智能。

translation: From our point of view, if a form of intelligence is unable to help us make a sound decision, the value of the intelligence is relatively low.
transcript: 但这个智能如果它不能帮人做决策，实际上从我们的角度去看，就是它的价值是非常低的。

translation: We know that AlphaGO has defeated humans being, it is because its decision-making quality is better than that of humans.
transcript: 那就像我们看到的，那AlphaGO它战胜了人类，实际上就是因为它作出的决策的质量比人类要高。

translation: Why no unmanned vehicle can hit the road yet?
transcript: 那西为什么现在无人车还无法上路？

translation: Simply put, its intelligence level is not up to the standard of a man.
transcript: 很简单，就它的智能达不到人的这个水准。

translation: In that case, the so-called intelligence is of no value at all.
transcript: 但一旦它达不到这个人的水准，那所谓的这些智能其实它变得毫无价值。

translation: A L3-level unmanned vehicle program can only assist driving.
transcript: 你只能一个L3水准的一个一个无人车程序，那你只能辅助驾驶嘛。

translation: The entire industrial chain is still monopolized by those big factories, such as BMW and Mercedes-Benz, as you haven't changed anything and your best role is to assist them.
transcript: 那么垄断整个产业链的，还是原来的势力，是那些是那些厂，还是宝马、奔驰那些大厂，因为你并没有改变什么，你只是辅助他们的用。

translation: It is because the intelligence level is not that advanced yet.
transcript: 所以压根儿我们觉得就是说智能还没有到那个程度。

translation: So, from our point of view, there is only one standard to evaluate a particular form of intelligence, that is, can it replace people to make decisions?
transcript: 所以呢从我们角度看呢，就真正的智能只有一个衡量的标准，就是它能不能替代人做决策。

translation: However, we are still in the era of man-machine coordination, and we humans need to work together with machines to make decisions.
transcript: 虽然现在我们还是一个人机协同的时代，需要人跟机器一起做决策。

translation: But AI can only be valuable when its decision-making quality is better than that of a man, or more efficient than man, and only till that moment, we could call it AI.
transcript: 但真正人工智能能产生价值只是说就在那个点上，如果它做的决策的质量比人还要高，或者比人效率要高，它就是人工智能。

translation: But now take a look at the relationship between a city and data, we know that its power is unlimited, and we can use the power to make a difference.
transcript: 那么我们回来最后，就是因因为呢，现在大家已经看到了，就哪怕是像城市跟大数据，它的力量也是无穷的，实际上它能改变很多的事情。

translation: We can use it to improve urban planning and urban residents' convenience level.
transcript: 它能改变城市的规划，甚至能改变市民的舒适度。

translation: Last month, in my visit to the UK, I once had an interesting dialogue with its former Prime Minister Cameron.
transcript: 因为我上个月的话，我在英国的时候，跟它的前首相像卡梅隆，我也探讨过这个问题。

translation: I told him that in a way AI could change the outcome of an election, "Are you, as a politician yourself, in fear that you might lose your job someday?"
transcript: 因为我说，你看很多这些人工智能程序已经能改变这个选举的这个结果了，对，然后你们这些政治家会不会觉得以后要失业。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么？

translation: Because AI can decide your chance of winning.
transcript: 因为人工智能能跟能决定你能不能当选。

translation: He was very excited about it.
transcript: 呃他特别激动呵，那个他。

translation: We had a long discussion on this topic.
transcript: 最后呢其实我们探讨了好久。

translation: There was only one thing that we agree on, that is we believed that AI couldn't have the integrity that we find in humans.
transcript: 就是最后其实大家觉得有一个东西其实是人工智能无法具备的，就是从英文讲我们叫integrity，就是正直。

translation: AI has no humanity so it can be both evil and good.
transcript: 因为它是没有人性的，所以它既可以作恶，也可以作善。

translation: So, for builders of future cities and owners of big data, what is the most important thing?
transcript: 那么作为未来的就是城市的建设者和大数据拥有者来说，那最重要的是什么？

translation: Integrity is the most important thing.
transcript: 其实已经变成了，正直。

translation: Many inexplicable phenomena occur in our market, for example, you might be harassed by real estate agents or insurance agents, but why?
transcript: 那现在市场上非常多的乱象，就说有很多的黑产，因为大家可能都被骚扰过，对吧，这个卖房子的、卖保险的，但为什么？

translation: It is because owners and users of those data assets haven't followed the track of integrity.
transcript: 因为那些数据资产的拥有者、使用者，他们偏离了正直这个轨道。

translation: That is the very reason behind those inexplicable phenomena.
transcript: 所以这是我们在市场上看到的，所有这些乱象产生的根源。

translation: Because it is very easy to tell if a data company has any morals or integrity.
transcript: 就是数据公司到底有没有道德，它是不是正直，所以特别简单。

translation: I will use this sentence to end my speech.
transcript: 因为我最后就用这句话来收场。

translation: 7 years ago we wanted to create a big data company that helped enterprises to make smart decisions, and enable big data to help people live a better life.
transcript: 那我们想做什么，就我们七年前想用数据改变企业决策，然希望这个数据会改善大家的这种生活。

translation: However, at this stage, I think the most important thing is that we need to be a big data company with integrity.
transcript: 但现在其实我们觉得在目前这个阶段，最重要的是我们首先要做一家正直的大数据公司。

translation: Thank you.
transcript: 谢谢大家！
